sect1.title: Summary
sect1.para: TRA (1975), TPB (1985, 1991), IM (2000), and RAA (2010), together, offer behavioral researchers and practitioners a comprehensive framework of psychosocial factors to understand decision‚Äêmaking across a wide range of behavioral domains and populations. The explanatory power of the models, validated in thousands of studies, the intuitive appeal of their constructs, explicit causal specifications, and standardized measurement protocols help account for its popularity, and numerous promising areas of future research and application remain to be explored, including expanded efforts to more accurately model the social and structural factors that shape health behaviors.
